material.mattext:
Consider the following code snippet:

 

function myFunc(param2,  param1){
   return param1  - param2;

}

myFunc(10,4)

 

WHAT IS THE RETURNING OUTPUT?
Which method is used to retrieve an existing database entry?"
Which command will install express in Node.js?
Node and terminal programs running in the background are called what?
Which of the following is NOT associated with the front-end?

`Which of the following URLs will access the route shown?
let express = require('express');
let app = express();
let http = require('http');
let port = 5000;
app.get('/', (req, res) => {
    res.send('Hi!');
});
app.listen(port);

Which of the following URLs will access the route shown?

let express = require('express');
let app = express();
let http = require('http');
let port = 5000;
app.get('/:animal', (req, res) => {
    let animal = req.params.animal;
    res.send(\`The \${animal} ran away!\`);
});
app.listen(port);

What will the following route do?

app.get('*', (req, res) => {
    res.send("Sorry, this is not a valid path!")
});
Send the message if any unrecognized URL/route is entered
Send the message if any known URL/route is entered
Send the message if any unrecognized required parameters are entered
Send the message if any unrecognized port number is entered
Which node module makes JavaScript backwards-compatible by translating newer syntax into older syntax?

Consider the following:

server.listen(port, ()=>{
    console.log('server listening on port %s,' port);
});
 Where will the message display when the server is started?
Which of the following contains a list of dependencies and the command that runs the application?
Which of the following contains the code used to set up the application?`
Where do the project dependencies get installed?`

consider the following route on PORT 5000 :

         app.get('/:animal', (req, res) => {
                let animal = req.params.animal;
                res.send(\`The \${animal} ran away!\`);
         });
What will display in the browser at the following URL?
 http://localhost:5000/dog

Node.js is both a server and client-side language
NodeJS is supported on which of the following platforms?
NodeJs uses an event-driven, non-blocking IO model
The command to install nodemon in NodeJS is:
We can kill a process in NodeJS using the keyboard shortcut?
What does the fs module stand for?
What is the full form of npm?
The callback is an asynchronous equivalent for a function
The callback is a technique in which a method calls back the caller method
Which of the following statement defines Express?
Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features to develop web and mobile applications.
Express is an application framework that provides a robust set of features to develop desktop-based applications.
Which of the following statement is used to execute the code of the sample.js file?
Which of the following types of applications can be built using Node.js?
Which of the following areas, Node.js, is not advised to be used?
Which of the following route parameter formats are valid?
Node.js is a JavaScript based framework/platform built on Google Chrome's JavaScript V8 Engine.
Node.js is a java based framework
How are Node based web servers are different from traditional web servers?
Node based server uses a single threaded model and can services much larger number of requests than traditional server like Apache HTTP Server.
Node based server process request much faster than traditional server.
There is no much difference between the two.
Which of the following command will show version of node?
Which of the following is true about package.json?
package.json is present in the root directory of any Node application/module.
package.json is used to define the properties of a package.
package.json can be used to update dependencies of a Node application.
Which of the following statements is the valid way  to use the Node module 'fs' in a Node based application?
Which of the following modules is required to create a web server?
The command to create a directory is:
The command to delete a file is:
list of dependencies, and commands that run the application
list of static assests, such CSS and client-side JavaScript
Templates that are used to render the pages of the application
Code that sets up the application
How do you run a node application?
How do you cancel or stop a node app from running?

const person = {
  name: ['Bob', 'Smith'],
  age: 32,
  gender: 'male',
  interests: ['music', 'skiing'],
  bio: function() {
    alert(this.name[0] + ' ' + this.name[1] + ' is ' + this.age + ' years old. He likes ' + this.interests[0] + ' and ' + this.interests[1] + '.');
  },
  greeting: function() {
    alert('Hi! I\'m ' + this.name[0] + '.');
  }
};

what is the output of "person.bio"
{ this.name[0] + ' ' + this.name[1] + ' is ' + this.age + ' years old. He likes ' + this.interests[0] + ' and ' + this.interests[1] + '.'; }
pop up window with the following content: Bob Smith is 32 years old. He likes music and skiing
Bob Smith is 32 years old. He likes music and skiing.
A server sending a database request."
A database responding to a server.
Which method is used to create a new database entry?
Which of the following is true about Node.JS?
Node.JS is used to delevop I/O intensive web applications like video streaming sites, single page applications and other web application.
Node.js is a JavaScript based framework/platform built on Google Chrome's JavaScript V8 Engine.
Node.js is open source and is completely free to use.
Please in your answer write the open question handed to you.
Please in your answer write the open question handed to you.
Which of the following is NOT  built-in module of NodeJS
Select the elements of the NodeJS event loop

The event loop runs one way (it's a first-in, first-out queue) and goes through several phases. First, the timers execute, which are the timers scheduled with the JavaScript functions setTimeout and setInterval. Next, I/O callbacks run, so if any I/O has returned from one of the nonblocking network calls, this is where your callback is triggered. The poll phase is where new I/O events are retrieved, and then callbacks scheduled with setImmediate run at the end. This is a special case because it allows you to schedule a callback to run immediately after the current I/O callbacks already in the queue. This might shound abstract at this stage, but what you should take aaway is the idea that although Node is single-threaded, it does give you tools to write efficient and scalable code.
How should middleware in express be ordered?
Middleware should be ordered the same way it should be run.
The order of middleware doesn't matter.
It only matters that all middleware is placed after imports and before the listen call
middleware should be grouped after routes, and in the order it should run

The ordering of middleware in our application can dramatically affect the way it behaves. Execution can be stopped by omitting next(), and middleware can be combined to implement features such as authentication.
Express middleware may be combined with the .use() method of the express framework
Connect [software provided in express] provides a method called use for combining middleware components.
Which line of code would send a GET request and print the response to the node console.
This is from the project demonstrating HTTP POST and GET requests on page 83 of  Node Cookbook: Forth Edition.
The HTTP module is built into Node JS and usually doesn't need to be installed seperately.
The node http module is the way that that node sends GET and POST requests

According the Node.js in Action,  one way to verify that Node is properly installed is to run the following command in the terminal.

$ npm -v

$ node -v

will return the version of node installed and

 

$ npm -v

will return the version of npm installed.

$ node -v

will return the version of node installed and

 

$ npm -v

will return the version of npm installed.
One of the strengths of Node and JavaScript in general is their _____________ programming model.
Which of the following is NOT considered an advantage of Node JS

Developers can write web applications in one language, which helps by reducing the context switch between client and server development, and allowing for code sharing between client and server, such as reuing the same code for form validation or game logic.
JavaScript is a compilation target, and there are a number of languages that compile to it already
Node uses one virtual machine (V8) that keeps up with the ECMAScript standard.
JavaScript is the language used in various SQL databases (such as CouchDB and MongoDB)

JavaScript is the language used in various No-SQL databases(such as CouchDB and MongoDB)

CouchDB and MongoDB are No-SQL non-relational databases that store data using a document model similer to JavaScript objects. 

Because they use JavaScript objects as their default method of organizing data, there is no need to use other languages to interact with the database. This makes JavaScript, and by extension NodeJS ideal for working with these databases.

Non-blocking I/O means your program can make a request for a network resource whil doing something else, and then, when the network operation has finished, a callback will run that handles the result.
When you install NodeJS you also install a built in package manager named Yarn
When NodeJS installs, It installs a package manager named NPM, not Yarn
When NodeJS installs, It installs a package manager named NPM, not Yarn
Node JS is a web browser based on Google Chrome

Correct:

While Node JS is based on the same underlying engine as Google Chrome (the V8 chromium engine), it is not a browser. Node JS is a Runtime Environment (RTE) that allows us to run JavaScript without a browser.

Incorrect:

NodeJS is not a browser. 

Node JS is a Runtime Environment (RTE) based on the V8 Chromium engine developed by google. This same engine can be found under most browsers, chrome, and the chromebook operating system.
Node JS IS a web browser based on Google Chrome
Node JS is not a web browser based on Google Chrome
